en: Interview with Danny Wilson, local artist who grew up in East Tennessee, conducted by Casey Kaufman. Wilson dicusses his experiences in Gatlinburg and what impact it had on his art career growing up. He explains how the wildfires have influenced some of his recent artwork. Conducted over Zoom due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This is a representative quote from the interview: "As a person who wanted to grow up and make a living doing that, it was pretty captivating to me to watch the different ways people were making money with their art. So, I think to me that was the one thing that stood out about Gatlinburg that was different."

Interview with Danny Wilson, local artist who grew up in East Tennessee, conducted by Casey Kaufman. Wilson dicusses his experiences in Gatlinburg and what impact it had on his art career growing up. He explains how the wildfires have influenced some of his recent artwork. Conducted over Zoom due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This is a representative quote from the interview: "As a person who wanted to grow up and make a living doing that, it was pretty captivating to me to watch the different ways people were making money with their art. So, I think to me that was the one thing that stood out about Gatlinburg that was different."

Attribution 4.0 International
Requires:
1. credit be given to copyright holder and/or author
2. copyright and license notices be kept intact
Permits:
1. distribution of derivative works
2. distribution, public display, and publicly performance
3. making multiple copies
Can you state your name and tell us about yourself?
Can you tell us a little bit about your work as an illustrator, the focus of your artwork, and your career?
Can you talk about your experiences in Gatlinburg and any changes you've noticed over time?
Can you talk about any memories that you have of the days or weeks leading up to the wildfire?
Could you tell early on that this was going to be a historic event?
When was the first time you went to Gatlinburg after the wildfires? Can you talk about that experience?
Do you have any reflections or thoughts on how Gatlinburg recovered from this fire or the response to it?
Can you talk about some of the stories that inspired you or moved you as you were listening to these interviews?
Can you talk about how you saw the mountain toughness come out in these interviews, in the community, and whether that phrase resonates with you?
Can you walk us through your artistic process and what that looks like for you?
Have you created artwork from moving images before?
Was there anything surprising about the process of creating the art or the content and stories that were shared?
Is there anything we haven't talked about that you want to share?

seo.title: Interview with Danny Wilson, 2022-01-13 - Rising From the Ashes Oral Histories
